summary: Completed comprehensive frontend testing of music streaming app. Found critical routing and layout architecture issues that prevent access to key pages for public users.

critical_routing_bugs.issue: Category pages (/category/rock, /category/pop, /category/jazz, /category/rap) are under PrivateLayout requiring authentication
critical_routing_bugs.impact: Public users cannot access genre category pages - redirected to login

critical_routing_bugs.issue: Discover page (/discover) requires authentication under PrivateLayout
critical_routing_bugs.impact: Public users cannot access discover page - redirected to login

critical_routing_bugs.issue: Trending Songs page (/trendingsongsall) requires authentication under PrivateLayout
critical_routing_bugs.impact: Public users cannot access trending songs page - redirected to login

ui_bugs.issue: Missing sidebar navigation for public users - only navbar present
'Start Listening' button routes to /login instead of All Songs page

missing_features.issue: SideBarNotLogged.jsx exists but not integrated into PublicHomeLayout
missing_features.impact: No sidebar navigation with Rock, Pop, Jazz, Rap genre links for public users

passed_tests: Public homepage loads at '/' with hero section and music sections
Navbar 'Home' link redirects to '/' correctly for not logged-in users
Login page has 'Continue with Google' OAuth button
Register page has 'Continue with Google' OAuth button

success_percentage.frontend: 40% - Basic pages work but core routing architecture broken

action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Fix routing architecture - move category pages, discover page, and trending songs page from PrivateLayout to public routes. Add SideBarNotLogged to PublicHomeLayout. Fix 'Start Listening' button routing to All Songs instead of login.
